meanings.definition: A person who lags behind or makes slow progress.
meanings.sent1: The laggards in the race struggled to keep up with the others.
meanings.sent2: The teacher patiently waited for the laggards to finish their assignment.
meanings.sent3: The laggards in the group project finally caught up after a lot of effort.
meanings.sent4: The team was held back by the laggards who couldn't match the pace.
meanings.sent5: The laggards were always the last to arrive, dragging their feet along the way.

meanings.definition: Falling behind in movement, progress, or development.
meanings.sent1: The laggards students struggled to catch up with the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The company's laggards sales figures were a cause for concern.
meanings.sent3: The laggards pace of the snail race made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The laggards growth of the plant surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent5: The laggards clock seemed to tick slower than all the others in the room.
